featured.text: Only John Glenn has received the ticker-tape parade more than once.
Glenn, who retires from the U.S. Senate next month, joins a list of individuals and sports teams honored with more than one ticker-tape parade.
Glenn’s first ticker-tape parade on March 1, 1962, after his Mercury flight, is considered the largest ever in New York.
Police and Glenn’s parade was attended by 500,000 -- a figure that appeared generously inflated.

other.text: Why does the report say that the figure of Glenn’s second parade was “inflated”?
After that event, Glenn recalled the 1962 parade, saying, "It was just so enormous.
What impressed Glenn most in the 1962 parade? (A)

The 1962 celebration "was more enthusiastic -- a lot more people," said one spectator, who as a young newlywed attended Glenn’s first parade and came from her Brooklyn home again for Glenn’s second parade.

definition.zh_def: 一種公開的遊行活動，通常包括音樂、舞蹈和花車，慶祝特定的事件或節日。
definition.en_def: A public procession, often featuring music, dancing, and floats, celebrating a specific event or holiday.
definition.example: The city held a grand parade to celebrate Independence Day.
